title.narrative: Tamil Nadu Sustainable Urban Development Program

description.narrative: To improve urban services delivery in participating ULBs in a financially sustainable manner and to pilot improved urban managementpractices in selected cities.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Maintain Institutional Capacity for Urban Governance Component | Description :Tamil Nadu shall mainatain aproject management unit to carry out Part A of the Project with resources, powers, functions, staffing, and expertise acceptable tothe Bank. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Number of participating ULBs with updated GIS maps.
No. of participating ULBs with new e-governance systems operational.
Percentage of participating ULBs seeking investment support reporting delivery of improved urban services in their cities.
Proportion of new / rehabilitated water / sewer connections achieved against aggregate target amongst participating sub-projects inthese sub-sectors (Percentage)
Length of Storm Water Drains constructed / rehabilitated and made operational under the project for Greater Chennai
Repayment rates on sub-loans by TNUDF to ULBs
Average increase on MoUD Service Level Benchmarks (SLB) Index for the 'Model Cities' related to solid waste household collection coverage.
Improved ULB empowerment in the ‘Model Cities’.

baseline.value: Authority to approve capital works is low in terms of Administrative Sanction (AS) powers.

target.value: Each ULB has appointed a high quality Technical Expert Cell.

actual.value: The GO for AS issued and the Technical Expert Cells are in place at Model Cities.

title.narrative: Improved ULB citizen engagement in the ‘Model Cities’.

baseline.value: Grievances are received offline. Use of online grievance application is limited because of low levels of awareness, technicalglitches and poor visibility of the website.

target.value: Each ULB has implemented all the e-governance modules as identified by CMA. Each ULB hasestablished an online platform to exchangeinformation with citizens regarding key service deliveryparameters.

actual.value: All three model cities completed implementation of 29 municipal e-governance modules and also met grievance redressal response timerequirement under its citizen charter in 80% of cases

title.narrative: Increase in Own Source Revenues (OSR) of ‘Model Cities’ in INR Crores over previous year with implementation of OSR improvement plans.

target.value: Aggregate increase of Rs. 75 crores in OSR of Model Cities over and above the OSR in 2016-17.
